title: The best-performing stock of the year rose nearly 10-fold, while the 2nd-best averted disaster to surge 1,000% in a wild 2023
textContent:
Quick, name the best-performing stock of 2023 so far.  No, it isn’t related to artificial intelligence — although shares of AI-linked chip maker Nvidia Corp. 
        NVDA,
        +0.14%
       have surged more than 200% thus far on the year.   The so-called Magnificent Seven group of stocks, which includes Nvidia, have produced illustrious year-to-date returns. Both collectively and individually, those stocks have been all the rage on Wall Street this year. 
      
       Apple shares 
        AAPL,
        -0.07%
       have gained nearly 50% so far this year, while Microsoft’s stock 
        MSFT,
        -0.35%
       has risen by about 56%, both classes of Google parent Alphabet’s stock 
        GOOG,
        -1.04%
       
        GOOGL,
        -0.94%
       have risen nearly 60%, shares of Amazon 
        AMZN,
        -0.17%
       have rallied over 80%, Tesla’s shares 
        TSLA,
        +1.77%
       have more than doubled and the stock of Facebook parent Meta Platforms 
        META,
        +0.72%
       has almost tripled in the period, according to FactSet data.  However, none of those stocks can hold a candle to the best performers of 2023, as gauged by MarketWatch.  Based on companies that boasted a market value of at least $1 billion as of Dec. 26, the No. 1 and No. 2 best performers were Soleno Therapeutics 
        SLNO,
        -1.62%
       and online used-car dealer Carvana 
        CVNA,
        +0.78%.
       Their stocks registered among the best gains of the year, according to data commissioned by MarketWatch and compiled by Dow Jones Market Data.
        Created with Highcharts 9.0.1Soaring SolenoShares of Soleno have gained almost 2,000% ytd.Soleno Therapeutics Inc.Source: FactSetCreated with Highcharts 9.0.12023Dec.-50005001,0001,5002,0002,500% 
       Shares of Soleno have enjoyed a stratospheric advance, up more than 1,900%, as the biotech company in the fall announced positive results for its diazoxide choline extended-release tablets designed to treat Prader-Willi syndrome, a rare genetic disease that can lead to intellectual disability, obesity and other symptoms.  Representatives of Soleno didn’t immediately respond to an email requesting comment. 
        Created with Highcharts 9.0.1Riding higherCarvana's stock has seen a more than 1,000% gain.Carvana stockSource: FactSetCreated with Highcharts 9.0.1'23-25002505007501,0001,250% 
       Meanwhile, Carvana’s stock skyrocketed 1,030% as the automotive retailer, which had been struggling to reduce its debt load, staged a turnaround for the ages that helped it stave off a cash crisis.  Mike McKeever, head of capital markets at Carvana, characterized 2023 to MarketWatch “as a defining year” for the company. Shares of competitor CarMax 
        KMX,
        +2.53%
       and the U.S.-listed stock of Auto Trader 
        AUTO,
        -0.25%
       
        ATDRY,
        -0.88%
       were up a relatively pedestrian 28% and 45%, respectively, so far this year.  Read: The 10 days that moved the stock market the most in 2023 Other notable outperformers on the year include buy-now-pay-later lender Affirm Holdings 
        AFRM,
        +2.40%,
       which has soared more than 400% thus far in 2023.   Biotech and biopharma companies — which are known for their volatility — as well as crypto-related entities were among other stocks that stood out in what has been described as the “weirdest bull market in decades,” with the S&P 500 
        SPX
       and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA
       hovering at or near record highs on the heels of policy moves by the Federal Reserve that imply that the central bank is satisfied with the outcome of its quest to vanquish surging inflation.

          What do those performances mean for next year? It’s hard to say.  Momentum can turn on a dime and in-favor sectors can quickly lose ground to new high-flying stock darlings.  Be careful out there.  Check out: What a strong ‘Santa Claus rally’ says about the U.S. stock market in January — and 2024 See: One of Wall Street’s biggest bears says the Fed is giving investors a good reason to be bullish in 2024
excerpt: Forget about the Magnificent Seven and AI. The stocks that did the absolute best during the year were tied to biotech and crypto — along with one car-related...
